result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren A. FREE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment/schooling combination.  
Obtain HSED/GED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for current prescribed medications for mental health.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lauren A. FREE

records.addlTxt:
Stipulation and Order to Amend Criminal Bond.
It is hereby ordered that Ms. Free's cash bond in the above referenced case be modified from a $1,000.00 cash bond to a $1,000.00 signature bond with the conditions of that bond being that she 1) maintain absolute sobriety with the exception of any prescribed medications taken in their prescribed dosages; 2) reside at the Nova House and participate in their treatment program; 3) sign an authorization allowing the State to verify her location with Nova; and 4) that upon either voluntarily leaving the program or being terminated from the program, that Ms. Free would report back to the Manitowoc County Jail and her bond would be converted back into a cash bond.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail is DENIED.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 12-10-15 at 9:15 a.m.
BAIL MOTION - 
Attorney Hoff argues for a reduction of bail.
Attorney Prost opposes any bail modification at this time.  If the defendant gets into treatment, the State would have no objection to a modification then.
The Court comments and denies the motion to modify bail at this time.  If the defendant becomes involved in treatment, the court can revisit the motion.
State to draft the order.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 11-04-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary, criminal damage to property, entry into locked vehicle and theft.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-26-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that she report to the Two Rivers City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnsh bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
Request for Warrant for Communications or Other Information; Findings and Order; Warrant for Content of Communications; Affidavit; Return of Officer.  (ORDERED SEALED BY THE COURT)
